problem_text:
6.5. Positive p-harmonic functions in a cone
Let u denote a positive locally bounded solution of the equation ∆pu = 0 in
a cone vanishing at the boundary.
Problem. Prove that
u(x) = C |x|^λ ψ( x/|x| ),
(6.5)
where λ > 0 and C is an arbitrary constant.
The existence of solutions appearing in the right-hand side of (6.5) was
studied in [37] and [103]. If the cone is the half-space {x : x_n > 0}, formula
(6.5) becomes u(x) = C x_n.
